symptoms: Intermittent stumble with long narrative of attempted repairs and environmental factors.

root_cause_hypotheses.hypothesis: Minor EVAP leak at purge line or canister
root_cause_hypotheses.evidence: P0456 present, gas cap already replaced twice, rodent activity possible.
P0420 repeated, high mileage, exhaust smell at idle.

root_cause_hypotheses.hypothesis: Intermittent ignition knock from carbon buildup
root_cause_hypotheses.evidence: Reports of spark knock on mountain climbs and original plugs just replaced.

most_likely_cause: Combination of small EVAP leak and aging catalytic converter affecting drivability.

recommended_actions.step: Perform EVAP smoke test focusing on purge and vent lines
recommended_actions.why: Locates leak causing P0456 and fuel odor.

recommended_actions.step: Compare upstream/downstream O2 sensor waveforms during road test
Inspect exhaust hangers and joints for leaks
recommended_actions.why: Addresses exhaust smell and potential false catalyst readings.

recommended_actions.step: Reset fuel trims after repairs and monitor freeze-frame data

safety_notes: Work in ventilated area when testing exhaust components.
Support vehicle securely before inspecting underbody.
disclaimers: Owner narrative condensed; further data logs may refine diagnosis.

confidence.assessment: Mixed symptoms and numerous prior repairs reduce certainty.

confidence_uplift_requirements: EVAP smoke test results with leak location
O2 sensor waveform capture during cruise

customer_readiness_check.short_reason: Pending EVAP and catalyst tests before final quoting.
